Dog rabies cases on the rise in northern Thailand

A doctor from the Department of Disease Control at the 9th Disease Prevention Office said on February 9 that rabies infections have been increasing in the northeast of Thailand over the past few months, with a total of 74 cases.

In the current year (October 2019 - September 2020), 67 and 7 people, respectively, were found to be positive in rabies tests in the northeastern counties of Srinagar and Bilaram, for a total of 74 people.
Everyone has been vaccinated against rabies in the past.
The doctor is urging people to get their pet vaccinated against rabies and to avoid contact with the saliva of any animals they suspect may be infected.
Rabies can be transmitted from cats and bats as well as dogs.
If a person gets infected and develops the disease, they will die almost 100% of the time, but if they get vaccinated before they develop the disease, they can prevent death.

FUJI Develops System to Prevent Accidents Caused by Leaving Vehicles | Central Japan Economic Newspapers: Economic Information on Aichi, Gifu, Mie, and Shizuoka Prefectures

FUJI (head office: Chiryu City), which manufactures and sells electronic parts installation robots and machine tools, has started developing a system to prevent children from being left behind in cars.
The system is set up so that when a sensor is attached to the car and detects human movement, it sends a notification to the phone or chat.
We are currently conducting proof-of-concept experiments with our own shuttle vehicles.
Protecting children from the pain of being left behind.
Currently, they are conducting a proof-of-concept experiment with two shuttle vehicles for their in-house English conversation after-school program for children, teracoya THANK.
Sensors that detect human movement from the temperature difference between people and their surroundings are installed in three locations on the ceiling of the car.

If the vehicle's engine is turned off and the door is closed, and after a certain amount of time has passed, the vehicle detects movement of a person, then it automatically sends a warning notification.
By coordinating the state and information of the engine and door, it can prevent misdetection as much as possible.
The alert notification is sent through the cloud.
You can call the number you registered in advance or display it on your computer or smartphone chat.
You can register multiple addresses and they take care not to miss anything.
The trial will continue until the end of February.
"During the experiment, we also found that there were peripheral issues other than the system," said Kamiya Ichikazu, head of the 2nd Section of the Innovation Promotion Department.
For example, he said, he was able to pick up a variety of school bus-related challenges, such as creating an environment that allows drivers to focus on driving.
I'm putting all my energy into spreading the solution."
The development of the anti-abandonment system was triggered by a series of abandoned bus incidents across the country.
From employees with young children, suggestions were made as to what could be done to keep children safe.

We decided to develop this product because we wanted to use the knowledge we gained through our FA (Factory Automation) related business, such as IoT (Internet of Things) and sensor-based information management.
FUJI's anti-theft system is easy to use.
The sensors can be installed by simply pinning them to the ceiling.
Because it can be easily attached to the shuttle bus, it makes it easier to introduce and aims to promote its widespread use.
In the future, we will be looking to collaborate with nurseries and kindergartens, as well as considering productization.

[Opinion] Kishu City is creating an end-of-notice booklet and distributing it to residents who wish to receive it.

"Last year, when we published the 'Obituary Handbook,' which covers all the necessary procedures and forms for writing an obituary, and lists of assets and family trees, many people came to pick it up for themselves.
There are also classes on how to write an obituary and how to organize your life before you die, and it seems that "end of life" has become a part of the culture of the people in the prefecture.
The end note of the town of Echizen is 35 pages.
Chapter 5 begins with a review of your life, and you write down your current health status, financial situation, future care needs, end-of-life medical wishes, and funeral and burial preferences.
There are also sections for things you want to do in the rest of your life and messages to people you care about.
I’m sure it’s going to break my bones to write that there are 35 pages, but it’s not necessary to bury all of them.
What do you want to be remembered for by your family and those around you.
The point is to make it clear what the goal is.
In bookstores, there are various notebooks that are tailored to your purpose, and it is recommended to start writing from the place where you can write.
In 2009, the word "end-of-life" was born, and it was used in relation to job hunting.
Two years later, in 2011, the Great East Japan Earthquake occurred.
Many people have come to realize the reality that death can come suddenly, and there are more people who are preparing for their own end and the end of life.
It's been over 10 years since then.
The new coronavirus pandemic that has swept the world has not yet subsided.
Prices have risen due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine, and electricity bills have skyrocketed this winter to unimaginable prices.
On the other hand, wages are not going up as fast as the cost of living, and many people are struggling to make ends meet.

On the other hand, the days when funeral expenses, nursing expenses, and grave maintenance could be shared by relatives and friends are long gone, and nowadays it is rare for a single child to be born.
Also, life expectancy has increased significantly compared to the past, but there is a dilemma that the risk of dementia and care needs increases as we get older.
It is important to remember that the background to the fact that the end of life is not a one-off event but a settled state is that there is a growing social anxiety.
Either way, no one wants to put too much pressure on their partner or kids.
“Dying with Dignity” is a key phrase in the Ending Notetaker popularity, but it’s not something you should take too far.
Wishes and preferences should not be kept secret, but should be discussed with family members and prepared for calmly.

The Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology decided on February 10 that "not wearing masks is the basic rule" for children and students at graduation ceremonies.

Prefectural and municipal education committees are considering waiting for official notification from the Ministry of Education to determine their response.
There were also calls for caution over the Education Ministry's decision to drop its policy of requiring masks in all school activities from the new academic year in the spring.

"Children are confused when there is no mask response from one day to the next," the elementary school principal said. "It's natural that more and more children will take off their masks after we decide that wearing masks is optional."

On February 10, the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology decided that from April, it would not require the use of masks in school education activities, following the government's new guidelines on the use of masks.
In chorus, physical education, and club activities, masks are not worn.

For the 2022 fiscal year, we will request infection countermeasures in accordance with the current health management manual, and we will inform the education committee and schools on the matter of notices after April.

Graduation ceremonies at junior high, middle, and high schools, as well as universities, will be held with basic mask-wearing by graduates, faculty, and participating students, even if ventilation measures are implemented.

Toba City announced on the 10th that a total of 600,000 yen in child-rearing allowance (other households) was mistakenly paid to 11 households with 12 people in the Reiwa 3rd year child-rearing allowance special payment.

The city will provide 50,000 yen as a subsidy to high school students and children under the age of 18 in households that are exempt from the residential tax.

The company that was commissioned to provide the data had extracted the target children from the data, but the staff member had mistakenly added the data to the data because they thought that high school students were not included in the data, and they were paid twice.

Promotion Council for the Decarbonization of Amami Airport Held Discussions on the Matter = On the 9th, the Promotion Council for the Decarbonization of Amami Airport held discussions in Kusari-cho, Amami City.

The "Kagoshima Airport Low Carbon Promotion Council" (Chairman: Takashi Ando, Chief of the Construction Section of the Kagoshima Prefectural Island Division, 13 members) which is composed of the prefecture and airlines using the airport, held its second meeting at the airport on the 9th.
All members, including online members, attended.
The exchange of opinions was focused on setting the goal of decarbonization and introducing renewable energy, with solar power generation as the main subject.

The Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism has set a total goal of reducing greenhouse gas emissions from airports by 46% (compared to 2013) by 2050, with the aim of achieving zero emissions by 2050.
In response, the council held its first meeting in November last year, and is aiming to establish a plan ahead of other airports on the other islands in the prefecture.
The second meeting, as with the first, will be closed except for the opening.
After the meeting, President Atsushi Anno told reporters that the meeting confirmed the amount of greenhouse gas emissions from the airport.

The two sides have been working on negotiations in line with the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism's guidelines, aiming to set targets and introduce renewable energy, the sources said.
According to the distribution material, the benchmark 13th year's CO2 emissions of the same airport facilities and vehicles was 1476 tons (excluding aircraft).

Of these, the emissions from the lighting and air conditioning of seven facilities, including the airport terminal building, account for about 90 percent, followed by airport lights (84 tons) and airport vehicles (71 tons).
The council will discuss reducing the emissions of these facilities and vehicles.
"We are at a crossroads," said Anjo. "The direction of the committee is in line, and I would like to firmly compile the interim report."
In the future, the third meeting will hear the interim report, and the fourth meeting will hear the final report, and then the plan will be formulated.
"Sakasama Real Estate" opens Okinawa Naha branch office to bring people to the island. People looking for a place to live are recruited as landlords. |Society & Economy |Nankai Daily News
Opening event to deepen understanding of "sakasama real estate" through talk sessions = 8th, famous town

The Okinawa Yoron Branch Office of the Sakasama Real Estate website, which helps people who want to challenge themselves by renting vacant houses and shops, held its opening event on August 8th at the Entaku community space in the popular town of Yoron.
The operating company will explain the outline of the service through the talk session.

"If we can do this in Oki-Naruko, we can bring people to the island and create a movement that will change the island," said Tsukinoba's representative director, Toshio Takahashi, who oversees the branch office.

Sasakawa Realty works in reverse of the usual real estate process, by revealing the information of those who want to rent and contacting the landlord, and if they agree, they will sign the contract themselves.
As a proof-of-concept experiment to uncover potential vacant homes and build relationships through vacant homes, On-Co Co., Ltd. (headquarters in Mie Prefecture) began operating in June 2020.
The opening of the branch office is the seventh in the region and the first in Kyushu.
It is the first in the country on an island.
The event had about 20 participants, including On-Co and Tsukino-ba staff, staff from the town offices of Wakaba and Shimane, and local residents.

"As the movement to bring people from outside the island is becoming more active, I thought that if we could utilize empty houses and empty stores, the town and the island would become more lively," said Okubo, explaining the background of the branch office opening.
"I want to connect with people who have properties on the island or who want to do something and help them in any way I can, whether it's one or many properties," he said.

On-Co’s Watanabe Gakushi, the representative, said, “We need to talk with the locals about how they want to use each vacant house, who they want to come and live there, and what criteria they want to use.”
"The more people connect with each other, the more information will come in," he said, calling for participation and cooperation in discussions with the islanders and in providing information.
